intro: Vincetoxicum gonocarpos var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth false bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes many climbing and twining plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its aggressive growth habit, it can become invasive in certain regions.
